column1: One day he met a friend and related to him all his troubles. The friend sympathized very much with him
column2: and promised to think over the matter
column3: and call in a little while and tell him what to do. He did so; in a few days he visited the old man and put down four bags full of stones and gravel before him."Look here
column5: said he. Your sons will get to know of my coming here today
column6: and will inquire about it. You must pretend that I came to discharge a long-standing debt with you
column7: and that you are several thousands of rupees richer than you thought you were. Keep these bags in your own hands
column8: and on no account let your sons get to them as long as you are alive. You will soon find them change their conduct toward you. Salaam
column9: I will come again soon to see how you are getting on."When the young men got to hear of this further increase of wealth they began to be more attentive and pleasing to their father than ever before.
